300w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" data-width=\"300\"></noscript></a><figcaption>Reggaeton.</figcaption></figure><ul><li>Calle 13 – \"Atrévete-te-te\"</li><li>Daddy Yankee – \"Impacto\"</li><li>Hector El Father – \"Maldades\"</li><li>Voltio feat. Jowell &amp; Randy – \"Pónmela\"</li><li>Don Omar – \"Salió El Sol\"</li><li>Wisin &amp; Yandel – \"Sexy Movimiento\"</li><li>Tito El Bambino feat. Jowell, Randy, &amp; De La Ghetto – \"Siente El Boom (Remix)\"</li><li>Angel y Khriz – \"Ven Bailalo\"</li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table><table><tbody><tr><th>Tuff Gong Radio</th></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/30036/1183375-300px_tuff_gong.svg.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1183375\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.3\" data-width=\"300\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 300px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:30.0%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/30036/1183375-300px_tuff_gong.svg.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1183375\"><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" data-width=\"300\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/3/30036/1183375-300px_tuff_gong.svg.png\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/3/30036/1183375-300px_tuff_gong.svg.png 300w\"><noscript><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/3/30036/1183375-300px_tuff_gong.svg.png\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/3/30036/1183375-300px_tuff_gong.svg.png 300w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" data-width=\"300\"></noscript></a></figure><ul><li>Stephen Marley – \"Chase Dem\"</li><li>Bob Marley &amp; The Wailers – \"Concrete Jungle (The Unreleased Original Jamaican Version)\"</li><li>Bob Marley &amp; The Wailers – \"Pimper's Paradise\"</li><li>Bob Marley &amp; The Wailers – \"Rat Race\"</li><li>Bob Marley &amp; The Wailers – \"Rebel Music (3 O'Clock Roadblock)\"</li><li>Bob Marley &amp; The Wailers – \"Satisfy My Soul\"</li><li>Bob Marley &amp; The Wailers – \"So Much Trouble in the World\"</li><li>Bob Marley &amp; The Wailers and Damian Marley – \"Stand Up Jamrock\"</li><li>Bob Marley &amp; The Wailers – \"Wake Up &amp; Live (Parts 1 &amp; 2)\"</li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table><table><tbody><tr><th>The Vibe 98.8</th></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/30036/1183377-thevibe98.8.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1183377\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.56016597510373\" data-width=\"241\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 241px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.0%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/30036/1183377-thevibe98.8.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1183377\"><img alt=\"For those that gots to get down.\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 241px) 100vw, 241px\" data-width=\"241\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/3/30036/1183377-thevibe98.8.png\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/3/30036/1183377-thevibe98.8.png 241w\"><noscript><img alt=\"For those that gots to get down.\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/3/30036/1183377-thevibe98.8.png\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/3/30036/1183377-thevibe98.8.png 241w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 241px) 100vw, 241px\" data-width=\"241\"></noscript></a><figcaption>For those that gots to get down.</figcaption></figure><ul><li>R. Kelly – \"Bump n' Grind\"</li><li>Mtume – \"C.O.D. (I'll Deliver)\"</li><li>Alexander O'Neal – \"Criticize\"</li><li>RAMP – \"Daylight\"</li><li>The Isley Brothers – \"Footsteps in the Dark\"</li><li>Jodeci – \"Freek'n You\"</li><li>Lloyd – \"Get It Shawty\"</li><li>Jill Scott – \"Golden\"</li><li>Loose Ends – \"Hangin' on a String (Contemplating)\"</li><li>Freddie Jackson – \"Have You Ever Loved Somebody\"</li><li>Dru Hill – \"In My Bed (So So Def remix)\"</li><li>Marvin Gaye – \"Inner City Blues (Make Me Wanna Holler)\"</li><li>Minnie Riperton – \"Inside My Love\"</li><li>Barry White – \"It's Only Love Doing Its Thing\"</li><li>C.J. – \"I Want You\"</li><li>The SOS Band – \"Just Be Good to Me\"</li><li>Ginuwine – \"Pony\"</li><li>Raheem DeVaughn – \"You\"</li><li>Ne-Yo – \"Because of You\"</li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table><table><tbody><tr><th>Vladivostok FM</th></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/30036/1182900-vladivostokfm_svg.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1182900\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.59183673469388\" data-width=\"245\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 245px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:59.2%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/30036/1182900-vladivostokfm_svg.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1182900\"><img alt=\"Music from the Eastern Bloc.\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 245px) 100vw, 245px\" data-width=\"245\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/3/30036/1182900-vladivostokfm_svg.png\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/3/30036/1182900-vladivostokfm_svg.png 245w\"><noscript><img alt=\"Music from the Eastern Bloc.\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/3/30036/1182900-vladivostokfm_svg.png\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/3/30036/1182900-vladivostokfm_svg.png 245w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 245px) 100vw, 245px\" data-width=\"245\"></noscript></a><figcaption>Music from the Eastern Bloc.</figcaption></figure><ul><li>Kino – \"Группа крови\" (Gruppa Krovi / Blood type)</li><li>Marakesh – \"Ждать\" (Zhdat' / To Wait)</li><li>Zveri – \"Квартира\" (Kvartira / The Flat)</li><li>Seryoga – \"Король ринга\" (Korol' Ringa / King of the Ring)</li><li>Seryoga – \"Liberty City: The Invasion\"</li><li>Splean – \"Линия жизни\" (Liniya Zhizni / Lifeline)</li><li>Basta – \"Мама\" (Mama / Mother)</li><li>Leningrad – \"Никого не жалко\" (Nikogo ne Zhalko / A pity for no one)</li><li>Ranetki Girls – \"О тебе\" (O Tebe / About You)</li><li>Dolphin – \"РЭП\" (RAP / Rap)</li><li>Glukoza – \"Швайне\" (Schweine / [from German language] Pigs)</li><li>Ruslana – \"Wild Dances (Ukrainian FM Version)\"</li><li>Oleg Kvasha – \"Зеленоглазое такси\" (Zelenoglazoe Taksi / GreenEyed Taxi) (Club Remix)</li><li>Max Lorens – \"Схожу С Ума\" (Shoju S Uma / Losing my mind)</li><li>Dyshi – \"Взгляни На Небо\" (Vzglyani Na Nebo / Look to the Sky)</li><li>Quest Pistols – \"Мама\" (Mama / Mother)</li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table><h2>Downloadable Content</h2><p>Prior to the release of <b>Grand</b> <b>Theft</b> <b>Auto</b> <b>IV</b>, Rockstar announced that there would be two packages of downloadable content exclusive to the Xbox 360 version of the game, promising one of them would be out before the end of 2008. Microsoft was rumored to have paid 50 million dollars to keep the DLC exclusive to the Xbox 360 version of the game, although this sum was never confirmed. Despite Rockstar's promise, as 2008 dragged on, the DLC was delayed to an unspecified date in 2009. On November 19th, 2008, USA Today revealed the details on the first downloadable content package, The Lost and Damned. This episode was also released for PS3 on April 13th, 2010.</p><h2>The Lost and Damned</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/4/46067/1066797-boxart.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1066797\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.1060606060606\" data-width=\"330\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 330px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:110.6%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/4/46067/1066797-boxart.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1066797\"><img alt=\"GTA: The Lost and Damned\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 578px) 100vw, 578px\" data-width=\"578\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/4/46067/1066797-boxart.jpg\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/4/46067/1066797-boxart.jpg 330w\"><noscript><img alt=\"GTA: The Lost and Damned\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/4/46067/1066797-boxart.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/4/46067/1066797-boxart.jpg 330w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 578px) 100vw, 578px\" data-width=\"578\"></noscript></a><figcaption>GTA: The Lost and Damned</figcaption></figure><p>The first piece of downloadable package for <b>Grand</b> <b>Theft</b> <b>Auto</b> 4 is titled \"The Lost and Damned\" and was released on February 17th for the Xbox 360 exclusively; it cost 1,600 Microsoft Points and was 1.78gb in size.</p><p>The package contains new missions, side missions, music and weapons; giving players between 10 and 20 hours of new gameplay. Although Niko Bellic appears in the DLC he is not the playable character; the player instead assumes the role of a very minor character from the main storyline, a biker named <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/johnny-klebitz/3005-8702/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-8702\">Johnny Klebitz</a>. He's a member of the Liberty City biker gang \"<a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/lost-mc/3015-2840/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2840\">The Lost</a>\" (the same gang Niko meets in the main game). Dan Houser, Vice President of Creative Development for Rockstar Games, has stated that the episode shows a different side of Liberty City, and will answer many mysteries from the main story. Even though players encounter \"The Lost\" biker gang several times throughout the main game as Niko, the story for \"The Lost and Damned\" will not be directly impacted by decisions you made in the main game.</p><p>The story is mainly set in areas which were rarely visited whilst playing as Niko. <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/billy-grey/3005-9594/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-9594\">Billy Grey</a>, the Lost leader, has been released from jail and starts to wreak havoc on the ' <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/angels-of-death/3015-2845/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2845\">Angels of Death</a>', a rival gang, which breaks the truce between the two gangs. The player takes the role of Johnny Klebitz, the vice-president of the Lost, who temporarily took over role as Leader of the gang whilst Billy Grey was in jail. Johnny tries to stay calm as Billy breaks the truces set up by Johnny, but how long will he last knowing the gang could be falling apart?</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/3316/837717-gtadlc8.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-837717\" data-size=\"medium\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"800\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 800px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/3316/837717-gtadlc8.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-837717\"><img alt=\"Johnny Klebitz and Billy Grey\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 480px) 100vw, 480px\" data-width=\"480\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/0/3316/837717-gtadlc8.jpg\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/0/3316/837717-gtadlc8.jpg 800w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/0/3316/837717-gtadlc8.jpg 480w\"><noscript><img alt=\"Johnny Klebitz and Billy Grey\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/0/3316/837717-gtadlc8.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/0/3316/837717-gtadlc8.jpg 800w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/0/3316/837717-gtadlc8.jpg 480w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 480px) 100vw, 480px\" data-width=\"480\"></noscript></a><figcaption>Johnny Klebitz and Billy Grey</figcaption></figure><p>The Lost and Damned has new weapons, such as the grenade launcher, pipe bomb, and sawn-off and automatic shotguns. The lighting has been reworked to appear more dramatic, and character models have been slightly improved. There are also new vehicles, such as Johnny's bike, which has been made easier to control than other motorbikes, as the player spends a lot of time riding it in the DLC. There is a safe house where Johnny can interact with his other brothers in the Lost, and try new minigames such as arm wrestling and card games, joining old favorites like pool. There are plenty of missions where Johnny rides out as part of a pack of the Lost in an organized formation with the leader in front, and his 'brothers' help him out in the tougher firefights. The player is encouraged to keep his brothers alive, and surviving members of the gang will receive a stats boost to their health, accuracy, and damage dealing after each mission. If a Lost member does die, he'll be replaced with a new brother with set-to-zero stats. Simply put, the longer they stay breathing, the more help they'll be. And the attempts to make the player feel like a member of a real biker gang don't stop there. When riding with the gang, a Lost logo will appear on the road to indicate where to ride in order to stay in formation. If the logo is properly followed, the player will be rewarded with dialogue with his brothers, as well as a small personal health boost and a vehicle health boost.</p><p>The Lost and Damned also includes new multiplayer modes. Some can simply be considered rehashes with motorbikes of older modes, while others are more noticeably different, like Chopper vs. Chopper, where one player runs through checkpoints in the city on a motorcycle while the other chases in a gun-toting helicopter. There is also a new revamped race mode where competing bikers are armed with clubs and take each other out in brutal fashion.</p><h2>New Weapons in The Lost and Damned</h2><table><tbody><tr><th>Thrown Weapons</th></tr><tr><td><h3>Pipebomb</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14440/1328148-wep_pipebomb.gif\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1328148\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.34736842105263\" data-width=\"95\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 95px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:34.7%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14440/1328148-wep_pipebomb.gif\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1328148\"><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 95px) 100vw, 95px\" data-width=\"95\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1328148-wep_pipebomb.gif\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1328148-wep_pipebomb.gif 95w\"><noscript><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1328148-wep_pipebomb.gif\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1328148-wep_pipebomb.gif 95w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 95px) 100vw, 95px\" data-width=\"95\"></noscript></a></figure><br />The <a href=\"../../pipe-bomb/93-1806/\" rel=\"nofollow \">pipe bomb</a> is a crude homemade device that creates a large explosion. A pipe bomb behaves exactly like a grenade, as it can be <a href=\"../../grenade-cooking/92-2651/\" rel=\"nofollow \">cooked</a> to shorten its detonation time.</td></tr></tbody></table><table><tbody><tr><th>Pistols</th></tr><tr><td><h3>Automatic Pistol</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14440/1328150-wep_pistol.gif\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1328150\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.57377049180328\" data-width=\"122\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 122px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:57.4%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14440/1328150-wep_pistol.gif\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1328150\"><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 122px) 100vw, 122px\" data-width=\"122\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1328150-wep_pistol.gif\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1328150-wep_pistol.gif 122w\"><noscript><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1328150-wep_pistol.gif\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1328150-wep_pistol.gif 122w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 122px) 100vw, 122px\" data-width=\"122\"></noscript></a></figure><br />The CZ 75 is a pistol with low damage, but can fire as fast as a machine gun. However, CZ 75 devours ammo due to its high rate of fire. It can outperform the Combat Pistol for power due to the rate of fire at which it dispenses ammunition.</td></tr></tbody></table><table><tbody><tr><th>Shotguns</th></tr><tr><td><h3>Sawn-off Shotgun</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14440/1328152-wep_sawedoffshotgun.gif\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1328152\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.27860696517413\" data-width=\"201\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 201px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:27.9%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14440/1328152-wep_sawedoffshotgun.gif\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1328152\"><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 201px) 100vw, 201px\" data-width=\"201\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1328152-wep_sawedoffshotgun.gif\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1328152-wep_sawedoffshotgun.gif 201w\"><noscript><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1328152-wep_sawedoffshotgun.gif\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1328152-wep_sawedoffshotgun.gif 201w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 201px) 100vw, 201px\" data-width=\"201\"></noscript></a></figure><br />This <a href=\"../../sawed-off-shotgun/93-1993/\" rel=\"nofollow \">sawn-off shotgun</a> is similar to the shotguns not included in TLAD, but with two big exceptions. It can only carry two rounds at a time, so for those of you who loved to go trigger happy with the combat shotgun, this might not be for you. On the plus side this gun can be used while on a bike, allowing some quick kills if you are close enough.</td></tr><tr><td><h3>Automatic Shotgun</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14440/1328144-wep_assaultshotgun.gif\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1328144\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.37016574585635\" data-width=\"181\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 181px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:37.0%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14440/1328144-wep_assaultshotgun.gif\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1328144\"><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 181px) 100vw, 181px\" data-width=\"181\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1328144-wep_assaultshotgun.gif\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1328144-wep_assaultshotgun.gif 181w\"><noscript><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1328144-wep_assaultshotgun.gif\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1328144-wep_assaultshotgun.gif 181w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 181px) 100vw, 181px\" data-width=\"181\"></noscript></a></figure><br />This <a href=\"../../armsel-striker/93-2076/\" rel=\"nofollow \">Armsel Striker</a> looks somewhat like a traditional grenade launcher, but instead fires shotgun shells. This gun, like the automatic pistol, takes a lot of ammo, but can quickly take out enemies and is somewhat effective on vehicles. The gun also fires more quickly than a normal shotgun, as it doesn't need to be pumped.</td></tr></tbody></table><table><tbody><tr><th>Grenade Launchers</th></tr><tr><td><h3>Grenade Launcher</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14440/1328145-wep_grenadelauncher.gif\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1328145\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.30041152263374\" data-width=\"243\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 243px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:30.0%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14440/1328145-wep_grenadelauncher.gif\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1328145\"><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 243px) 100vw, 243px\" data-width=\"243\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1328145-wep_grenadelauncher.gif\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1328145-wep_grenadelauncher.gif 243w\"><noscript><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1328145-wep_grenadelauncher.gif\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1328145-wep_grenadelauncher.gif 243w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 243px) 100vw, 243px\" data-width=\"243\"></noscript></a></figure><br />The <a href=\"../../hk69/93-2966/\" rel=\"nofollow \">HK69</a> grenade launcher is a very nice weapon that can fire grenades quickly and accurately. The grenades take about five seconds to detonate, but will blow up on contact with a vehicle or person. The grenade launcher holds one round, and must be reloaded after each shot.</td></tr></tbody></table><h2>New Radio Songs in The Lost and Damned</h2><table><tbody><tr><th>The Beat 102.7</th></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/30036/1183367-300px_beat_102.7.svg.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1183367\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.73333333333333\" data-width=\"300\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 300px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:73.3%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/30036/1183367-300px_beat_102.7.svg.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1183367\"><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" data-width=\"300\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/3/30036/1183367-300px_beat_102.7.svg.png\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/3/30036/1183367-300px_beat_102.7.svg.png 300w\"><noscript><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/3/30036/1183367-300px_beat_102.7.svg.png\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/3/30036/1183367-300px_beat_102.7.svg.png 300w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" data-width=\"300\"></noscript></a></figure><ul><li>Busta Rhymes featuring: Young Jeezy &amp; Jadakiss - \"I Walk Alone\"</li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table><h2>The Ballad of Gay Tony</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14440/1425556-agegateheader.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1425556\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.0280528052805\" data-width=\"606\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 606px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:102.8%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14440/1425556-agegateheader.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1425556\"><img alt=\"GTA: The Ballad of Gay Tony\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 622px) 100vw, 622px\" data-width=\"622\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1425556-agegateheader.jpg\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1425556-agegateheader.jpg 606w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/1/14440/1425556-agegateheader.jpg 480w\"><noscript><img alt=\"GTA: The Ballad of Gay Tony\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1425556-agegateheader.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1425556-agegateheader.jpg 606w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/1/14440/1425556-agegateheader.jpg 480w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 622px) 100vw, 622px\" data-width=\"622\"></noscript></a><figcaption>GTA: The Ballad of Gay Tony</figcaption></figure><p>On May 26, 2009, Rockstar Games announced the title of its second piece of downloadable content exclusive to the Xbox 360. The Ballad of Gay Tony tells the story of Luis Lopez.</p><p>Lopez had been the expected next protagonist, as he is the third major character in the GTA IV mission Impossible Trinity. Lopez is an assistant to the nightclub impresario Tony Prince (Gay Tony), who made a number of appearances in GTA <b>IV</b>. This installment of DLC focuses on the nightlife of <a href=\"/\">Liberty City</a> and makes use of many of the already present, but not interactive, night clubs and luxury spots throughout <a href=\"/\">Algonquin</a>. The episode contains new cars, new aircraft, and new weapons, including a new helicopter with mounted guns. It also brings back the parachute item, as seen in GTA San Andreas. Players can base jump from numerous tall buildings and locations around the open world map.</p><p>The Ballad of Gay Tony was released as a download and at retail as part of <a href=\"/\"><b>Grand</b> <b>Theft</b> <b>Auto</b>: Episodes from Liberty City</a>, which does not contain the original GTA <b>IV</b> content, but does have stand-alone, playable versions of The Lost and Damned and The Ballad of Gay Tony. This disc retailed for 39.99 USD at launch. This content, as well as the disc, was released on October 29th, 2009. The disc version and downloadable version were both released for PS3 on April13th, 2010.</p><h2>New Weapons in The Ballad of Gay Tony</h2><table><tbody><tr><th>Thrown Weapons</th></tr><tr><td><h3>Sticky Bombs</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14440/1329816-weapons_stickybombs.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1329816\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.051724137931\" data-width=\"58\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 58px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:105.2%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14440/1329816-weapons_stickybombs.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1329816\"><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 58px) 100vw, 58px\" data-width=\"58\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1329816-weapons_stickybombs.png\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1329816-weapons_stickybombs.png href=\"../../satchel-charge/93-1415/\" rel=\"nofollow \">Satchel Charges</a> can be used to tag vehicles or objects for remote detonation.</td></tr></tbody></table><table><tbody><tr><th>Pistols</th></tr><tr><td><h3>Pistol .44</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14440/1329815-weapons_pistol44.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1329815\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.51748251748252\" data-width=\"143\" handgun.</td></tr></tbody></table><table><tbody><tr><th>Submachine Guns</th></tr><tr><td><h3>Assault SMG</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14440/1329814-weapons_p90.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1329814\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.35585585585586\" data-width=\"222\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 222px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:35.6%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14440/1329814-weapons_p90.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1329814\"><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 222px) 100vw, 222px\" 222px) 100vw, 222px\" data-width=\"222\"></noscript></a></figure><br />The <a href=\"../../p90-smg/93-615/\" rel=\"nofollow \">P90</a> is a compact submachine gun; its lightweight design makes it ideal in urban environments. It is the only submachine gun that cannot be fired from a vehicle.<br /><h3>Gold SMG</h3><br /><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/9805/1344263-weapons_goldsmg.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1344263\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.63694267515924\" data-width=\"157\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 157px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:63.7%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/9805/1344263-weapons_goldsmg.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1344263\"><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 157px) 100vw, 157px\" data-width=\"157\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/0/9805/1344263-weapons_goldsmg.png\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/0/9805/1344263-weapons_goldsmg.png 157w\"><noscript><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/0/9805/1344263-weapons_goldsmg.png\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/0/9805/1344263-weapons_goldsmg.png 157w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 157px) 100vw, 157px\" data-width=\"157\"></noscript></a></figure> For the man who has everything. The Gold SMG is given to the player by Yusuf Amir after completion of the game, and is more powerful than the Micro Uzi. It is the least accurate SMG in the game due to the lack of a stock and the fact it is fired from the hip, as opposed to the sights being brought to view by a character.</td></tr></tbody></table><table><tbody><tr><th>Shotguns</th></tr><tr><td><h3>Explosive Shotgun</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14440/1329813-weapons_explosiveshotgun.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1329813\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.34955752212389\" data-width=\"226\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 226px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:35.0%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14440/1329813-weapons_explosiveshotgun.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1329813\"><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 226px) 100vw, 226px\" data-width=\"226\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1329813-weapons_explosiveshotgun.png\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1329813-weapons_explosiveshotgun.png 226w\"><noscript><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1329813-weapons_explosiveshotgun.png\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1329813-weapons_explosiveshotgun.png 226w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 226px) 100vw, 226px\" data-width=\"226\"></noscript></a></figure><br />The <a href=\"../../aa-12/93-2507/\" rel=\"nofollow \">AA-12</a> is an automatic shotgun capable of rapid fire action. The addition of explosive shells can turn this into a formidable weapon.</td></tr></tbody></table><table><tbody><tr><th>Sniper Rifles</th></tr><tr><td><h3>Advanced Sniper</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14440/1329812-weapons_advancedsniperrifle.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1329812\" data-size=\"small\" />The <a href=\"../../dsr-1/93-2904/\" rel=\"nofollow \">DSR-1</a> is a long range sniper rifle with a high rate of fire and added zoom function.</td></tr></tbody></table><table><tbody><tr><th>Machine Guns</th></tr><tr><td><h3>Advanced MG</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14440/1329811-weapons_advancedminimi.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1329811\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.32510288065844\" data-width=\"243\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 243px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:32.5%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14440/1329811-weapons_advancedminimi.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1329811\"><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 243px) 100vw, 243px\" data-width=\"243\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1329811-weapons_advancedminimi.png\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1329811-weapons_advancedminimi.png 243w\"><noscript><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" sizes=\"(max-width: 243px) 100vw, 243px\" data-width=\"243\"></noscript></a></figure><br />The <a href=\"../../m249-saw-mg/93-623/\" rel=\"nofollow \">M249 SAW</a> is a light machine gun with a high rate of fire, 900 rounds a minute.</td></tr></tbody></table><table><tbody><tr><th>Miscellaneous Equipment</th></tr></tbody></table><h3>Parachute</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/9805/1344213-weapons_parachute.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1344213\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.0576923076923\" data-width=\"104\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 104px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:105.8%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/9805/1344213-weapons_parachute.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1344213\"><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 104px) 100vw, 104px\" data-width=\"104\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/0/9805/1344213-weapons_parachute.png\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/0/9805/1344213-weapons_parachute.png 104w\"><noscript><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/0/9805/1344213-weapons_parachute.png\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/0/9805/1344213-weapons_parachute.png 104w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 104px) 100vw, 104px\" data-width=\"104\"></noscript></a></figure><p>Escape a falling helicopter with style! Or do you feel like base jumping off of a building? Well now you can, thanks to a <a href=\"../../parachute/93-504/\" rel=\"nofollow \">Parachute</a>!</p><h2>New Radio Songs in Ballad of Gay Tony</h2><table><tbody><tr><th>Vice City FM</th></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14440/1282878-6355_gta_iv_gay_tony_vice_city_fm.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1282878\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.91623036649215\" data-width=\"191\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 191px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:91.6%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14440/1282878-6355_gta_iv_gay_tony_vice_city_fm.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1282878\"><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 191px) 100vw, 191px\" data-width=\"191\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1282878-6355_gta_iv_gay_tony_vice_city_fm.jpg\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1282878-6355_gta_iv_gay_tony_vice_city_fm.jpg 191w\"><noscript><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1282878-6355_gta_iv_gay_tony_vice_city_fm.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/14440/1282878-6355_gta_iv_gay_tony_vice_city_fm.jpg 191w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 191px) 100vw, 191px\" data-width=\"191\"></noscript></a></figure><ul><li>Roachford - \"Cuddly Toy (Feel for Me)\"</li><li>Narada Michael Walden - \"Divine Emotions\"</li><li>Five Star - \"Find the Time\"</li><li>T'Pau - \"Heart and Soul\"</li><li>Mai Tai - \"History\"</li><li>Nu Shooz - \"I Can't Wait\"</li><li>Texas - \"I Don't Want a Lover\"</li><li>Marillion - \"Kayleigh\"</li><li>Hue and Cry - \"Labour of Love\"</li><li>Climie Fisher - \"Love Changes (Everything)\"</li><li>Hall &amp; Oates - \"Maneater\"</li><li>Curiosity Killed the Cat - \"Misfit\"</li><li>Coldcut &amp; Lisa Stansfield - \"People Hold On\"</li><li>Level 42 - \"Something About You\"</li><li>Jeffrey Osborne - \"Stay With Me Tonight\"</li><li>Womack &amp; Womack - \"Teardrops\"</li><li>Roxette - \"The Look\"</li><li>Re-Flex - \"The Politics of Dancing\"</li><li>'Til Tuesday - \"Voices Carry\"</li><li>Boy Meets Girl - \"Waiting for a Star to Fall\"</li><li>Prefab Sprout - \"When Love Breaks Down\"</li><li>Terence Trent D'Arby - \"Wishing Well\"</li><li>Wet Wet Wet - \"Wishing I Was Lucky\"</li><li>Scritti Politti - \"Wood Beez (Pray Like Aretha Franklin)\"</li><li>John Farnham - \"You're the Voice\"</li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table><h2>PC Version</h2><p>In August 2008, Rockstar announced that a PC version of <b>Grand</b> <b>Theft</b> <b>Auto</b> <b>IV</b> would be released on December 2, 2008. Due to the later release date and greater processing capabilities, the PC version is improved from the Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3 versions. The graphics are improved as the game will run in 2560 x 1600 resolution, with higher-quality textures and increased draw distances. Another enhancement is the ability to adjust the traffic density. The multiplayer allows 32 players, twice the 16 players allowed on the console version.</p><h3>GTA <b>IV</b> PC Video Editor</h3><p>The new Video Editor feature allows players to capture in-game footage, make real-time edits, and export those clips as .WMV movie files. The clips can also be spliced together into a video with post effects like music, text, transitions, and other features found in video editing programs. Videos can then be shared for other players to view and rate using the Rockstar Games Social Club TV.</p><p><b>Clip Capturing</b></p><p>At any time during the game (single or multiplayer), press the F2 key to dump the footage to the hard drive. Depending on how data intensive things are in the world at that time, the clip should be about 30 to 40 seconds long. Captured footage will be the action that occurs prior to pressing F2. This feature can be turned off to improve performance.</p><p><b>Launching the Video Editor</b></p><p>To execute the Video Editor, call it up using the in-game cellphone. After a prompt which states that any unsaved data will be lost, a menu for viewing and editing clips opens, with the following choices:</p><ul><li>Clips</li><li>Editor</li><li>Gallery</li><li>Upload</li><li>Online</li></ul><p>All footage captured in the game can be viewed in the Clips section. There are the standard DVD style controls for video playback. The camera can be moved when the right mouse button is held down.</p><p><b>Editor</b></p><p>The Editor allows users to name videos, string multiple clips together, and add music, titles, and transitions.</p><p>To quickly create a video to upload, make sure at least one clip is in the storyboard editing space and then hit the Web option in Export To Gallery.</p><p><b>Gallery</b></p><p>The section labeled Gallery contains all of the completed, exported videos. The most recently exported video is displayed in the preview window, and the thumbnails on the right side of the screen are arranged with the newest videos appearing at the top.</p><p><b>Upload</b></p><p>In the section labeled Upload, players can submit their web videos to the Social Club. The left side of the screen shows local videos that have created. The right side is a web portal displaying all the videos that have been uploaded.</p><p><b>Online</b></p><p>The Online section will minimize <b>Grand</b> <b>Theft</b> <b>Auto</b> <b>IV</b> and go to the Rockstar Games Social Club TV website using the default web browser. There users can view, rate, and comment on clips others have uploaded.</p><h2>Physics</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/11986/1834766-gta_iv_physics.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1834766\" data-size=\"medium\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"1280\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 1280px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/11986/1834766-gta_iv_physics.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1834766\"><img alt=\"Roadkill\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 480px) 100vw, 480px\" data-width=\"480\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/1/11986/1834766-gta_iv_physics.jpg\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/11986/1834766-gta_iv_physics.jpg 1280w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/1/11986/1834766-gta_iv_physics.jpg 960w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/1/11986/1834766-gta_iv_physics.jpg 480w\"><noscript><img alt=\"Roadkill\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/1/11986/1834766-gta_iv_physics.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/11986/1834766-gta_iv_physics.jpg 1280w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/1/11986/1834766-gta_iv_physics.jpg 960w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/1/11986/1834766-gta_iv_physics.jpg 480w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 480px) 100vw, 480px\" data-width=\"480\"></noscript></a><figcaption>Roadkill</figcaption></figure><p>GTA IV is the second game to be released with the middleware named \"Euphoria\". Euphoria gives character models muscles, joints, a motor nervous system, and environmental awareness. This means that characters are capable of protecting themselves from injury by doing things such as grabbing on to a hand rail as they are falling down a staircase, or covering their face using their arms. GTA <b>IV</b> is the first game in the franchise to use physics middlewares, and is also the first Open World game to use Euphoria. There are many other features that Euphoria helps simulate, ranging from grabbing onto a car door to making Niko dynamically struggle to stand up straight when he is drunk.</p><p>Havok is another middleware used in GTA <b>IV</b>. It is only used for rigid bodies and vehicle dynamics. A rigid body is an object that cannot be deformed in any way. Remember that while props such as fences can be broken, it does not mean that they are not rigid bodies; instead of them splintering dynamically like real life, the engine is simply switching out the models. Havok has been implemented with quite a few AAA games, and is currently the world's leading physics middleware.</p><h2>Dating</h2><p>Expanding on <a href=\"../../grand-theft-auto-san-andreas/61-7120/\" rel=\"nofollow \">GTA: San Andreas</a>'s dating simulations, GTA IV allows Niko to take dates to bars, bowling alleys, cabaret acts, comedy clubs, darts bars, and pool clubs. He can also take characters from the main storyline that are friends to these destinations in order to obtain various bonuses. At these places, the player either watches a short performance or plays a minigame, except when going drinking.</p><p>Going drinking results in Niko and his companion emerging from their watering-hole extremely inebriated and unable to walk or drive straight. This resulted in some controversy over the inclusion of drunk-driving. The safe way to get back home though, as in real life, is to hail a taxi.</p><p>Comedians <a href=\"../../ricky-gervais/94-999/\" rel=\"nofollow \">Ricky Gervais</a> and <a href=\"../../katt-williams/94-214/\" rel=\"nofollow \">Katt Williams</a> make appearances as themselves in comedy clubs.</p><h2>Internet</h2><p>GTA IV is the first in the series to feature a browsable, fictional Internet. Through computers at safe houses or <a href=\"../../tw-internet-cafe/95-306/\" rel=\"nofollow \">Tw@ Internet Cafes</a>, players can browse a substantial fictional Internet. It includes parodies of YouTube, MySpace, dating sites, and news sites. www.littlelacysurprisepageant.com is a site made to look like a trap for pedophiles. Visiting it results in an instant 5-star wanted level.</p><h3><u>Available Damned\")</u></h3><ul><li>angelsofdeathonline.com</li><li>banditmagazine.net</li><li>congressmanthomasstubbs.com</li><li>ecoelitevacations.com</li><li>genderrolldoll.com</li><li>globeoil.net</li><li>highmenspacetours.com</li><li>killdebtdead.com</li><li>lostmc.com</li><li>managingmillenials.org</li><li>morningwoodspa.com</li><li>trainyourselftolerant.com</li><li>uptownriders.net</li></ul><h3><u>(Sites that are only available on \"The Ballad of Gay Tony\")</u></h3><ul><li>www.bahamamamasclub.com</li><li>www.bleeter.biz</li><li>www.fuggie.com</li><li>www.goldforlife.biz</li><li>www.herculeslibertycity.com</li><li>maisonette9.com</li><li>www.princessrobotbubblegum.com</li><li>www.womenareidiots.net</li><li>www.youvebeencelibinated.com</li></ul><h2>Sales</h2><p>According to a financial report released by Take Two in February 2009, Grand Theft Auto IV has sold over 13 million copies worldwide across all platforms, making it one of the most popular video games of the 7th generation of video game consoles.</p><p>By March 2011, the game had closed in on the 20 million-units-sold mark.</p><h2>System Requirements</h2><ul><li><b>OS</b>: Windows Vista - Service Pack 1 / Windows XP - Service Pack 3</li><li><b>Processor</b>: Intel Core 2 Duo 1.8GHz, AMD Athlon X2 64 2.4GHz</li><li><b>Memory</b>: 1.5GB XP / 1.5GB Vista</li><li><b>Graphics</b>: 256MB Nvidia 7900 / 256MB ATI X1900</li><li><b>DirectX Version</b>: DirectX 9.0c Compliant Card</li><li><b>Hard Drive</b>: 16GB of Hard Disc Space</li><li><b>Sound Card</b>: 5.1 Channel Audio Card</li><li><b>Other Requirements</b>: Initial activation requires internet connection; Online play requires log-in to Games For Windows - Live and Rockstar Games Social Club (13 to register); software installations required including Adobe Flash, DirectX, Microsoft’s .NET Framework 3.0, Games For Windows - LIVE, and Internet Explorer.</li></ul><h2>Xbox 360 Game Installation</h2><p>Grand Theft Auto IV requires 6.5 GB of space to be installed on an Xbox 360 HDD.</p>",

        "site_detail_url": "https://www.giantbomb.com/grand-theft-auto-iv/3030-20457/"

    {
        "aliases": "Red Dead Redemption 2\nRDR2",
        "api_detail_url": "https://www.giantbomb.com/api/game/3030-56725/",
        "date_added": "2016-10-18 07:29:38",
        "date_last_updated": "2021-06-02 16:33:04",
        "deck": "The third game in Rockstar's Wild West-themed series is a prequel to the events of Red Dead Redemption, returning to the open-world action of its predecessor.",
        "description": "<p>Rockstar Games announced on October 18, 2016 through their trademark teasers that Red Dead Redemption 2 was in production and originally planned to be released in 2017. The game was delayed into the next year with a final release date of October 26, 2018 on <a href=\"/xbox-one/3045-145/\" data-ref-id=\"3045-145\">Xbox One</a> and <a href=\"/playstation-4/3045-146/\" data-ref-id=\"3045-146\">PlayStation 4</a>.</p><figure data-align=\"right\" data-size=\"medium\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/5/56742/3018749-7722163974-RDR2_.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-3018749\" data-ratio=\"0.625\" data-width=\"1728\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 1728px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:62.5%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/5/56742/3018749-7722163974-RDR2_.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-3018749\"><img alt=\"The protagonist, Arthur Morgan\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/5/56742/3018749-7722163974-RDR2_.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/5/56742/3018749-7722163974-RDR2_.jpg 1728w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/5/56742/3018749-7722163974-RDR2_.jpg 960w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/5/56742/3018749-7722163974-RDR2_.jpg 480w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 480px) 100vw, 480px\" data-width=\"480\"></a><figcaption>The protagonist, Arthur Morgan</figcaption></figure><p>The game is a prequel set in 1899. At this time, outlaw gangs are disappearing and the <a href=\"/wild-west/3035-826/\" data-ref-id=\"3035-826\">wild west</a> era is about to end. Players take the role of Arthur Morgan, the right-hand man of the Van der Linde gang. The gang struggles to survive as the law threatens to destroy its way of life once and for all. Characters from the previous game, including <a href=\"/john-marston/3005-9449/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-9449\">John Marston</a>, <a href=\"/bill-williamson/3005-15620/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-15620\">Bill Williamson</a>, and <a href=\"/dutch-van-der-linde/3005-15727/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-15727\">Dutch Van der Linde</a>, are also present.</p><p>Gameplay will follow the traditional Rockstar open world, with some new improvements and additions. The <a href=\"/moral-decisions/3015-93/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-93\">morality </a> mechanic from the previous game is greatly expanded. The player has a vast number of options for interacting with NPCs, who will remember those actions in future encounters and act accordingly.</p><p>Rockstar has emphasized how the world will continue without the player's direct intervention. Characters have daily schedules they fulfill. They have independent conversations with each other. The player will get the sense that the world exists without them. With these advancements, Rockstar is trying to create a more believable world than ever before.</p><p>The traditional gameplay is supplemented by a new <a href=\"/base-building/3015-1307/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1307\">base building</a> system and a greater focus on multiplayer in the wake of <a href=\"/grand-theft-auto-v/3030-36765/\" data-ref-id=\"3030-36765\">GTA Online</a>. Little is known about the multiplayer aspects of Red Dead 2, but the game is rumored to follow the multiplayer setup of Free Roam akin to Red Dead Redemption.</p><h2>Story</h2><p>After a botched ferry heist in 1899, the Van der Linde gang are forced to leave their substantial money stash and flee Blackwater. Realizing civilization's progress is ending the time of outlaws, they decide to gain enough money to escape the law and retire. They rob a train owned by Cornwall, who hires Pinkertons to apprehend them. The gang performs jobs to earn money, as Dutch continually promises the next heist will be their last. Following a shootout with the Pinkertons in Valentine, the gang relocate to Lemoyne, where they work simultaneously for the Grays and Braithwaites in an attempt to turn them against each other. However, the families double-cross them: the Grays kill a gang member during an ambush, while the Braithwaites kidnap and sell Jack to Bronte. The gang retaliate and destroy both families before retrieving Jack from Bronte, who offers them leads on work but eventually double-crosses them. Dutch kidnaps and feeds him to an alligator as revenge, which disturbs Arthur.</p><p>The gang robs a bank in Saint-Denis, but the Pinkertons intervene, killing Hosea and arresting John. Dutch, Arthur, Bill, Javier, and Micah escape the city via a ship heading to Cuba. A torrential storm sinks the ship, and the men wash ashore on the island of Guarma, where they become embroiled in a war between tyrannical sugar plantation owner Fussar and the enslaved local population. After helping the revolutionaries kill Fussar, the group secured transport back to the United States and reunite with the rest of the gang.</p><p>Dutch obsesses over one last heist and doubts Arthur's loyalty after he disobeys him by liberating John earlier than planned, naming Micah, his top lieutenant, in Arthur's place. Arthur becomes concerned that Dutch is no longer the man he knew, as he is becoming insular, abandons their ideals, and murders Cornwall. He is faced with his mortality when he is diagnosed with tuberculosis. Arthur reflects on his actions and how to protect the gang following his death, telling John to run away with Abigail and Jack and openly defying Dutch by aiding the local Native American people. When the Pinkertons assault the camp, Dutch becomes paranoid that a gang member is working as an informant. Several gang members become disenchanted and leave, while Dutch and Micah arrange one final heist of an Army payroll train.</p><p>Arthur's faith in Dutch is shattered when he abandons Arthur to the Army, leaves John for dead, and refuses to rescue Abigail when she is taken. Arthur and Sadie rescue Abigail from Milton, who names Micah as the Pinkertons' informer before Abigail kills him. Arthur returns to camp and openly accuses Micah of betrayal. Dutch, Bill, Javier, and Micah turn on Arthur and a newly returned John, but the standoff is broken when Pinkertons attack. The player can choose to have Arthur aid John's escape by delaying the Pinkertons or return to the camp to recover the gang's money. Micah ambushes Arthur, and Dutch intervenes in their fight. Arthur convinces Dutch to abandon Micah and leave. If the player has high honor, Arthur succumbs to his injuries and disease and dies while watching the sunrise; if the player has low honor, Micah executes him.</p><p>Eight years later, in 1907, John and his family are trying to lead honest lives. They find work at a ranch where John fights back against outlaws threatening his employer. Believing John is unwilling to give up his old ways, Abigail leaves with Jack. John takes a loan from the bank to purchase a ranch. He works with Uncle, Sadie, and Charles to build a new home and proposes to Abigail on her return. Afterward, learning Micah is still alive and formed his own gang, John, Sadie, and Charles assault his camp and find a recently arrived Dutch, who shoots Micah after a tense standoff and leaves in silence, allowing John to kill him and claim the gang's Blackwater stash to pay his debt. John then marries Abigail, and they start a new life on their ranch alongside Jack and Uncle, as Sadie and Charles leave for other pursuits.</p><p>The final scene shows Edgar Ross observing John's ranch, foreshadowing the events of <em>Red Dead Redemption</em>.</p><h2>External Links</h2><ul><li><p><a href=\"https://www.rockstargames.com/reddeadredemption/\" data-target=\"true\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Official website</a></p></li></ul>",

        "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><p>Far Cry 5 is the fifth numerical entry in Ubisoft's Far Cry series developed by <a href=\"/ubisoft-montreal-studios/3010-1559/\" data-ref-id=\"3010-1559\">Ubisoft Montreal</a> with support from <a href=\"/ubisoft-toronto-studios/3010-7060/\" data-ref-id=\"3010-7060\">Ubisoft Toronto</a>, <a href=\"/ubisoft-kiev/3010-8631/\" data-ref-id=\"3010-8631\">Ubisoft Kiev</a>, <a href=\"/ubisoft-shanghai-studios/3010-620/\" data-ref-id=\"3010-620\">Ubisoft Shanghai</a> &amp; <a href=\"/ubisoft-reflections/3010-921/\" data-ref-id=\"3010-921\">Ubisoft Reflections</a>. Like the games before it, Far Cry 5 takes places in an open world setting. This entry into the series takes place in <a href=\"/montana/3035-4530/\" data-ref-id=\"3035-4530\">Montana</a> and sees the protagonist freeing Hope County from a cult called Eden's Gate.</p><p>The game is to be release worldwide on March 27th, 2018 on the <a href=\"/xbox-one/3045-145/\" data-ref-id=\"3045-145\">Xbox One</a>, <a href=\"/playstation-4/3045-146/\" data-ref-id=\"3045-146\">PlayStation 4</a> &amp; <a href=\"/pc/3045-94/\" data-ref-id=\"3045-94\">PC </a> platforms.</p><h2>Far Cry 5 Arcade</h2><p>In addition to the more \"traditional\" single player campaign the game will include a free map editor called Far Cry 5 Arcade. Players will be able to create and share small maps that can offer single player, cooperative and multiplayer objectives. Assets from other Ubisoft games <a href=\"/far-cry-4/3030-46310/\" data-ref-id=\"3030-46310\">Far Cry 4</a>, <a href=\"/far-cry-primal/3030-51102/\" data-ref-id=\"3030-51102\">Far Cry: Primal</a>, <a href=\"/assassin-s-creed-iv-black-flag/3030-41518/\" data-ref-id=\"3030-41518\">Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag</a> &amp; <a href=\"/assassin-s-creed-unity/3030-45744/\" data-ref-id=\"3030-45744\">Assassin's Creed: Unity</a> are available for players to use to construct their maps and challenges.</p><p>Whilst Far Cry 5 Arcade is a separate mode from the main campaign, aside from the main menu, the Arcade mode can also be accessed from arcade cabinets found within the main game throughout the map and can earn in-game money and other rewards.</p>",
